Class AnalyzeSentenceService

java.lang.Object
unipd.edids.logicBusiness.services.AnalyzeSentenceService
public class AnalyzeSentenceService extends Object
Service class for analyzing sentence syntax and structure.

Responsibilities: - Perform syntax analysis on a given text, identifying grammatical structures such as nouns, verbs, and adjectives. - Use the StanfordCoreNLP pipeline to process and analyze text. - Validate input text and handle various constraints like length, format, and content. - Organize extracted data (e.g., tokens) into categories (e.g., nouns, verbs, adjectives) and maintain a sentence structure. - Generate syntax trees based on the parsed input text.

Design Pattern: - a Singleton design pattern is employed for the StanfordCoreNLP pipeline initialization to ensure efficient resource usage.

  • Method Details

    • analyzeSyntax

      public Sentence analyzeSyntax(String text)
      Performs syntax analysis for a given input text and returns a structured representation of the analyzed sentence.
      Parameters:
      text - The input text to be analyzed. Must be non-null, non-empty, and adhere to validation rules (e.g., acceptable characters and length).
      Returns:
      A Sentence object containing the structure, tokens, and metadata derived from the syntax analysis.

    • getSyntaxTree

      public edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree getSyntaxTree(String text)
      Generates a syntax tree for the first sentence in the given text.
      Parameters:
      text - the input text to be analyzed for syntax tree generation.
      Returns:
      the syntax tree of the first sentence if available, otherwise null.
